result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M. Combs

records.addlTxt: for Competency Examination signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant James M. Combs not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video for James M. Combs.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 1.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant James M. Combs not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video for James M. Combs.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Defendant has a felony case and Atty. Schwarz is hoping for a global resolution and requests another status conference date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant James M. Combs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video for James M. Combs.  Attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Ray C. Jr DOB 05/27/1966
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
